title: Vibhuti Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of Divine Glories
summary: In this chapter, Lord Krishna describes His divine manifestations and glories, explaining how He is the source of all creation and the essence of everything in the universe. He lists various important beings, objects, and phenomena that represent particular aspects of His divine nature. Arjuna acknowledges Krishna's supreme position and requests to know more about His divine opulences.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः | यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ||
verses.transliteration: śrībhagavānuvāca | bhūya eva mahābāho śṛṇu me paramaṁ vacaḥ | yatte'haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hitakāmyayā ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: O mighty-armed Arjuna, listen again to My supreme word, which I shall speak to you, who are delighted, for your benefit.
verses.explanation: Krishna begins the chapter by offering to speak further divine knowledge to Arjuna, who is receptive and devoted.

verses.sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः | अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ||
verses.transliteration: na me viduḥ suragaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣayaḥ | ahamādirhi devānāṁ maharṣīṇāṁ ca sarvaśaḥ ||
verses.translation: Neither the hosts of demigods nor the great sages know My origin, for, in every respect, I am the source of the demigods and sages.
verses.explanation: Krishna declares that even the gods and great sages don't fully know His origin, as He is the source of them all.

verses.sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् | असंमूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: yo māmajamanādiṁ ca vetti lokamaheśvaram | asaṁmūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate ||
verses.translation: He who knows Me as the unborn, the beginningless, the Supreme Lord of all the worlds—he, undeluded among men, is freed from all sins.
verses.explanation: Krishna explains the liberating power of recognizing His supreme, eternal nature.

verses.sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसंमोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः | सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च || अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः | भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ||
verses.transliteration: buddhirjñānamasaṁmohaḥ kṣamā satyaṁ damaḥ śamaḥ | sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo'bhāvo bhayaṁ cābhayameva ca || ahiṁsā samatā tuṣṭistapo dānaṁ yaśo'yaśaḥ | bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛthagvidhāḥ ||
verses.translation: Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from doubt and delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, self-control, calmness, pleasure, pain, birth, death, fear, fearlessness, nonviolence, equanimity, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame and infamy—all these various qualities of living beings are created by Me alone.
verses.explanation: Krishna enumerates various human qualities and experiences, explaining that they all originate from Him.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते | इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ||
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate | iti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāvasamanvitāḥ ||
verses.translation: I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds. Everything emanates from Me. The wise who know this perfectly engage in My devotional service and worship Me with all their hearts.
verses.explanation: Krishna declares Himself as the origin of everything and describes the proper response of the wise.

verses.sanskrit: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् | कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ||
verses.transliteration: maccittā madgataprāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam | kathayantaśca māṁ nityaṁ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca ||
verses.translation: The thoughts of My pure devotees dwell in Me, their lives are surrendered to Me, and they derive great satisfaction and bliss enlightening one another and conversing about Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes the joyful life of His devotees who constantly think and speak about Him.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् | ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ||
verses.transliteration: teṣāṁ satatayuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prītipūrvakam | dadāmi buddhiyogaṁ taṁ yena māmupayānti te ||
verses.translation: To those who are constantly devoted and worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna promises to give spiritual intelligence to His sincere devotees.

verses.translation: Out of compassion for them, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy with the shining lamp of knowledge the darkness born of ignorance.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes how He personally dispels the darkness of ignorance from the hearts of His devotees.

verses.sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः | अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ||
verses.transliteration: ahamātmā guḍākeśa sarvabhūtāśayasthitaḥ | ahamādiśca madhyaṁ ca bhūtānāmanta eva ca ||
verses.translation: I am the Self, O Arjuna, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all beings.
verses.explanation: Krishna reveals His presence in all beings as the indwelling Self and the temporal source of everything.

verses.sanskrit: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन | अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम् ||
verses.transliteration: sargāṇāmādirantaśca madhyaṁ caivāhamarjuna | adhyātmavidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatāmaham ||
verses.translation: Of all creations I am the beginning, the end and also the middle, O Arjuna. Of all sciences I am the spiritual science of the self, and among logicians I am the conclusive truth.
verses.explanation: Krishna declares His supremacy in both the material and spiritual realms.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च | अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताऽहं विश्वतोमुखः ||
verses.transliteration: akṣarāṇāmakāro'smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya ca | ahamevākṣayaḥ kālo dhātā'haṁ viśvatomukhaḥ ||
verses.translation: Of letters I am the letter A, and among compound words I am the dual compound. I am also inexhaustible time, and of creators I am Brahma.
verses.explanation: Krishna gives specific examples of His manifestations in language and time.

verses.sanskrit: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा | तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसंभवम् ||
verses.transliteration: yadyadvibhūtimatsattvaṁ śrīmadūrjitameva vā | tattadevāvagaccha tvaṁ mama tejo'ṁśasaṁbhavam ||
verses.translation: Know that all opulent, beautiful and glorious creations spring from but a spark of My splendor.
verses.explanation: Krishna explains that all magnificent things in creation are just partial manifestations of His glory.

verses.sanskrit: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन | विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ||
verses.transliteration: athavā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna | viṣṭabhyāhamidaṁ kṛtsnamekāṁśena sthito jagat ||
verses.translation: But what need is there, Arjuna, for all this detailed knowledge? With a single fragment of Myself I pervade and support this entire universe.
verses.explanation: Krishna concludes by stating that even a portion of His divine energy sustains the entire cosmos.
